definition: to seize power/to conquer the world/to establish and expand a business/to carve out a career for oneself
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
day/sky/heaven
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to run everything (idiom); to monopolize the whole business/not allow anyone else to have a look in

sentences.english: A young man must find his own way in the world without props and safeguards.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人必须在没有支持和保护之下自己来打天下。

sentences.english: I believe Carlos Vela is a player of the squad and the whole squad will be used over the season.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他是队中的一员，我们只有一支球队打天下。

sentences.english: When it comes to vegetables, one method of cooking definitely does not fit all.
sentences.chinese: 当谈到蔬菜，一种烹饪方法当然不能包打天下。

sentences.english: Some problems cannot be tackled solely on one's own.
sentences.chinese: 一个人的力量总是有限的，不能包打天下。

sentences.english: A man has to strike out for himself if he wants to get ahead.
sentences.chinese: 一个人要想出人头地，就得自己去打天下。

definition: to assist (usually a ruler)
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters
to start out by/to grow an enterprise beginning with/to begin one's career by
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters
to charge and break through enemy lines
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters
to rebel/to revolt
to seek shelter/to seek asylum
to take cities and seize territories (idiom)
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
lit. to take the yellow gown (idiom)/fig. to be made emperor/to take the crown
to transition to a new dynasty or regime
